alert.note: Alert for Frederick; Washington (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 07 at 9:32AM EDT until September 07 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of north-central and western Maryland, the northern Shenandoah Valley in northwestern Virginia, and the eastern panhandle of West Virginia, including the following areas: in Maryland, Frederick and Washington. In Virginia, Clarke, Frederick, Page, Shenandoah and Warren. In West Virginia, Berkeley, Jefferson and Morgan. * WHEN...Until 4 PM EDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Slow-moving showers and thunderstorms producing very heavy rainfall rates may result in several instances of flash flooding through late afternoon. - Please visit https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
